name: Idempotency
description: Operations should produce the same result when called multiple times with the same parameters. Repeated calls should not cause additional side effects or change the system state further.
risk_if_violated: Non-idempotent operations can cause data corruption, duplicate processing, or inconsistent states when network retries, user double-clicks, or system failures occur.

examples.violation: A processPayment() method that charges the credit card every time it's called, even with the same transaction ID.
examples.better: Check if a transaction with the same ID already exists and return the existing result instead of processing again.

examples.violation: An updateUserProfile() method that appends tags to a user's profile on every call, creating duplicates.
examples.better: Replace the entire tag list or check for existing tags before adding, ensuring the same final state regardless of call count.
